net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.complex

Class AbstractUiWidgetListTable<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterListTable<ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER>,ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER extends ItemContainer<ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.feature.AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>
      • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.AbstractUiWidget<VALUE>
        • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.AbstractUiWidgetNative<ADAPTER,VALUE>
          • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.AbstractUiWidgetActive<ADAPTER,VALUE>

  • Type Parameters:
    ADAPTER - is the generic type of AbstractUiWidgetNative.getWidgetAdapter().
    ROW - is the generic type of a row in the value list.
    ITEM_CONTAINER - is the generic type of the ItemContainer.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadAccessKey, AttributeReadAriaRole, AttributeReadEditable, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadFocused, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadMode, AttributeReadModeFixed, AttributeReadModified, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadSelectedValue<ROW>, AttributeReadSelectionMode, AttributeReadStringTitle, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadSummary, AttributeReadTitleVisible, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadValueAdvanced<List<ROW>>, AttributeReadVisible, AttributeReadVisibleRecursive, AttributeWriteAccessKey, AttributeWriteAriaRole, AttributeWriteEditable, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteFocused, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteMode, AttributeWriteModeFixed, AttributeWriteModified, AttributeWriteOnlyFocused, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteSelectedValue<ROW>, AttributeWriteSelectionMode, AttributeWriteStringTitle, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteSummary, AttributeWriteTitleVisible, AttributeWriteTooltip, AttributeWriteValueAdvanced<List<ROW>>, AttributeWriteVisible, AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced, UiFeature, UiFeatureEvent, UiFeatureFocus, UiFeatureMessages, UiFeatureMode, UiFeatureSelectedValue<ROW>, UiFeatureValidation<List<ROW>>, UiFeatureValue<List<ROW>>, UiFeatureValueAndValidation<List<ROW>>, UiWidgetAbstractDataSet<ROW>, UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>, UiWidgetAbstractListTable<ROW>, UiWidgetListTable<ROW>, UiWidget, UiWidgetAbstractComposite, UiWidgetAbstractWithValue<List<ROW>>, UiWidgetActive, UiWidgetListBase<ROW>, UiWidgetListContainer<ROW>, UiWidgetNative, UiWidgetRegular, UiWidgetWithSelectedValue<ROW>, UiWidgetWithValue<List<ROW>>, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadTitle<String>, AttributeReadValue<List<ROW>>, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteId<String>, AttributeWriteTitle<String>, AttributeWriteValue<List<ROW>>, Accessibility, AbstractValidatableObject, HasValueValidators<List<ROW>>, ValidatableObject<List<ROW>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UiWidgetListTableGwt

    public abstract class AbstractUiWidgetListTable<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterListTable<ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER>,ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER extends ItemContainer<ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER>>
extends AbstractUiWidgetAbstractListTable<ADAPTER,ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER>
implements UiWidgetListTable<ROW>
    This is the base implementation of UiWidgetListTable.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • doSetValue

        protected void doSetValue(List<ROW> newValue,
                          boolean forUser)
        This method is called from the data-binding triggered by API methods such as AbstractUiWidget.setValue(Object, boolean). In many cases the data-binding already performs the required work to do. However, here is the place to implemented the custom logic to get the value from the actual widget. For details see AbstractUiWidget.doGetValue(Object, ValidationState).
        Overrides:
        doSetValue in class AbstractUiWidgetNative<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterListTable<ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER>,List<ROW>>
        Parameters:
        newValue - is the value to set. Typically a composite object (e.g. java bean) so its attributes are set to fields (see UiWidgetField).
        forUser - true if called from AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation.setValueForUser(Object), false if set from AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation.setValue(Object).
        See Also:
        AbstractUiWidget.doGetValue(Object, ValidationState)

      • doGetValue

        protected List<ROW> doGetValue(List<ROW> template,
                               ValidationState state)
                        throws RuntimeException
        This method is called from the data-binding triggered by API methods such as AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation.getValue(). In many cases the data-binding already performs the required work to do. However, here is the place to implemented the custom logic to get the value from the actual widget. The following cases have to be distinguished:
        • For native fields this method has to get the actual value from the underlying native widget (text-box, password-field, etc.).
        • For custom fields this method will be responsible to convert from the delegates value (see UiWidgetCustom.getDelegate()) to the proper value type. E.g. if you want to create a custom widget to edit your own datatype such as CustomerNumber based on a UiWidgetTextField you need to convert from String to CustomerNumber.
        • For custom composite widgets you should use AbstractUiWidget.getDataBinding(). UiDataBinding.createAndBind(net.sf.mmm.util.pojo.path.api.TypedProperty) that gives you high-level support and makes your live easy. Then there is no need to override this method.
        • For other cases, especially if <VALUE> is Void, there is nothing to do here.
        The implementation of this method has to correspond with the implementation of AbstractUiWidget.doSetValue(Object, boolean) .
        Overrides:
        doGetValue in class AbstractUiWidgetNative<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterListTable<ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER>,List<ROW>>
        Parameters:
        template - is the object where the data is filled in. May only be null if according to data-binding (e.g. if <VALUE> is an (immutable) Datatype).
        state - is the ValidationState. May be null (if the validation is omitted). Should only be used to propagate to AbstractUiWidget.getValueDirect(Object, ValidationState) of children.
        Returns:
        the current value of this widget. May be null if empty. If <VALUE> is String the empty String has to be returned if no value has been entered. In case <VALUE> is a mutable object (java bean) the template is NOT null and is to be returned by this method after the value(s) of this widget have been assigned. For immutable datatypes template will be null and this method has to create a new instance of <VALUE> based on the end-users input in the widget.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException
        See Also:
        AbstractUiWidget.doSetValue(Object, boolean)

      • initializeWidgetAdapter

        protected void initializeWidgetAdapter(ADAPTER adapter)
        This method is called from AbstractUiWidgetNative.getWidgetAdapter() to initialize the UiWidgetAdapter. All attributes of this widget need to be set in the UiWidgetAdapter.
        Overrides:
        initializeWidgetAdapter in class AbstractUiWidgetAbstractListTable<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterListTable<ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER>,ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER extends ItemContainer<ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER>>
        Parameters:
        adapter - is the UiWidgetAdapter to initialize.
